moves.1. d4: Hi everyone!!  This is a game netween two "annotators", fatcat2 & myself.  We will be having a rematch shortly.  He started with a queen pawn opening, and I was going to go into a Benko Gambit, until I saw one of his rescent annotated games where he crushed the Benko Gambit.
moves.1... Nf6 2. c4 c5 3. d5 b5: This move characterizes the Benko Gambit
moves.4... bxc4 5. Nc3 d6 6. e4 Nbd7 7. Bxc4 g: The Benko (or Benoni) isalso set up in a King's indian position.
moves.8. O-O Bg7 9. Bf4 Rb8: developing the Rook to an open file with a threat
moves.10. Rb1 Ng4: This move was played for 2 reasons.  1., to create a weakness on his Kingside, and 2, to play the knight to e5
moves.11. h3 Nge5 12. Nxe5 Nxe5 13. Bb3 O-O 14: Here, I should have seen he threat of Bh6
moves.15. Bh6 exd5: I did, however, see the threat of Bxh3, because gxh3 leads to Nxf3 , losing the Q
moves.16. Bxd5 Bxh3 17. Bxg7 Kxg7 18. Qe3 Be6: Opening the F-file for the Rook
moves.22. b3 Qb6 23. Qh4 c4+ 24. Kh1 Qe3 25. Q: I"m not sure if he saw the knight hanging on c3
moves.25... Rf7 26. Qxe6 Qxc3 27. Rbc1 Qf6: I'm ahead a whole piece, why not not offer a queen trade?
